column4: i am having authentication failure with su root, but i have the password set correctly, and can even login as root
i was using root as an example, i cannot su to any user
you are using the password of the User you are suing TO?
so if you 'sudo adduser billgates' and 'su billgates'  it also fails eh?
odd. makes me wonder what changes you did to the system
im thinking, a mistake i made a while back, might be causing it
but i dont know how to fix su
untill we kniow what you changed.. i cant really help.
sounds like you got some perms wrong from your chown.. that may be very very veyr hard to fix
<Ghosty> Dr_Willis, im thinking, a mistake i made a while back, might be causing it
<Ghosty> i ran chown incorrectly, and accidentaily changed all perms from root dir on.. i fixed it, and fixed sudo
so you chowned  EVERYTHING by mistake..  souinds liek it may be time for a reinstall..
thats the only sure fix - i can think of.
or reinstall every package.. (which may take even longer)
